00042 struct clargs {
00043   Path command;               
00044   Contrast contrast;            
00045   int plane;                    
00046   float center;                   
00047   Path data_name;             
00048   Path result_name;           
00049   bool beverbose;                               
00050   bool SaveInt;                                 
00051 
00053   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]); 
00054 };
00055 
00057 const string TSconfigDesc =
00058   " Must consist only of the strings containing the the following"
00059   " strings:\n"
00060   "    <float> <string>\n"
00061   "The first component (float value) represents the angle in degree"
00062   " at which the projection was recorded, while the second component"
00063   " gives the file name of the image with the projection. For example:\n"
00064   "    -25.5 ../acquire/projection_-25.5.tif\n"
00065   "The path to the file is relative to the path of the data file.";
00066 
00067 clargs::
00068 clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) : 
00069   result_name("ts-<data file>-<plane>.tif"),
00070   plane(0),
00071   center(0),
00072   beverbose(false),
00073   SaveInt(false),
00074   contrast(Contrast::ABS)
00075 {
00076 
00077   poptmx::OptionTable table
00078         ("Tomosynthesis reconstruction.",
00079          "The program reads file which describes the images containing TS"
00080          " projections and performs TS reconstruction of the requested plane.");
00081 
00082   table
00083         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "ARGUMENTS:")
00084         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &data_name, "data file",
00085                  "Input file describing the projection images.",
00086                  TSconfigDesc)
00087         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &result_name, "result",
00088                  "Output reconstructed image.", "", result_name)
00089 
00090         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "OPTIONS:")
00091         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &contrast, 'C', "contrast",
00092                  "Input component.",
00093                  "Type of the contrast presented in the sinogram. "
00094                  + Contrast::Desc, contrast.name())
00095         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &plane, 'y', "plane",
00096          "Plane of the reconstruction.", "Relative to the rotation center.")
00097         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &center, 'c', "center",
00098                  "Rotation center.", CenterOptionDesc, toString(center))
00099         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &SaveInt,'i', "int",
00100          "Output image(s) as integer.", IntOptionDesc)
00101         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00102         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00103 
00104   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00105         exit(0);
00106   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00107         table.usage();
00108         exit(0);
00109   }
00110 
00111   command = table.name();
00112 
00113 
00114   if ( ! table.count(&plane) )
00115         exit_on_error( command, "The reconstruction plane must be explicitly set."
00116                                    " Use option " + table.desc(&plane) + " for this.");
00117   if ( ! table.count(&data_name) )
00118         exit_on_error(command, string () +
00119                                   "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&data_name)+".");
00120   if ( ! table.count(&result_name) )
00121     result_name = upgrade(data_name, "ts-") + "-" +  toString(plane) + ".tif";
00122 
00123 
00124 
00125 }
00126 
00131 struct proj_info {
00132 
00133   vector< pair<float,string> > list; 
00134   string name;                                  
00135   float angle;                                  
00136   unsigned icur;                                                
00137 
00143   inline proj_info(const string & data_name) {
00144 
00145         // Opens the data file.
00146         FILE* input_list = fopen(data_name.c_str(), "r");
00147         if ( ! input_list )
00148           exit_on_error ("scan input", "Could not open input data file"
00149                                          " '" + data_name + "' for reading.");
00150     if ( feof(input_list) )
00151           exit_on_error ("scan input", "The input file"
00152                                          "\"" + data_name + "\" is empty.");
00153 
00154         string fdir(data_name, 0, data_name.rfind("/")+1);
00155         const int MAXSTRING = 1024;
00156         float nangle;
00157         char curin[MAXSTRING];
00158         while ( ! feof(input_list) &&
00159                         fscanf (input_list, "%f %s\n", &nangle, curin) == 2 )
00160           list.push_back( pair<float,string> 
00161                                           ( nangle*M_PI/180, cdpath(fdir,curin) ) );
00162     if ( ! feof(input_list) )
00163           warn ("scan input", "Certain part of the input file"
00164                         " \"" + data_name + "\" could not be scanned."
00165                         " succeeded in " + toString(list.size()) + " strings.");
00166         fclose(input_list);
00167 
00168     if ( ! list.size()  )
00169           throw_error("scan input", "Input file \"" + data_name + "\""
00170                                   " does not provide any input info.");
00171 
00172         angle  = list[0].first;
00173         name   = list[0].second;
00174         icur   = 0;
00175 
00176   }
00177 
00183   inline bool advance() {
00184         if ( icur >= list.size() )
00185           return false;
00186         angle = list[icur].first;
00187         name = list[icur].second;
00188         icur++;
00189         return true;
00190   }
00191 
00192 };
00193 
00194 
00195 
00197 int main( int argc, char *argv[] ) {
00198 
00199   const clargs args(argc, argv);
00200         
00201   proj_info proj_i(args.data_name);
00202   Shape shape=ImageSizes(proj_i.name);
00203   if (shape(1)/2 <= abs(args.plane) )
00204         exit_on_error(args.command, "The reconstruction plane is outside the image:"
00205                                   " Image width: " + toString(shape(1)) + ", reconstruction"
00206                                   " plane: " + toString(args.plane) + ".");
00207 
00208   string first_name = proj_i.name;
00209   Map proj(shape), result(shape);
00210 
00211   ProgressBar bar(args.beverbose, "reconstruction", proj_i.list.size() );
00212   while ( proj_i.advance() ) {
00213     ReadImage(proj_i.name, proj, shape);
00214         ts_add(proj, result, Filter(), args.center,
00215                    args.contrast, proj_i.angle, args.plane);
00216         bar.update();
00217   }
00218   bar.done();
00219 
00220   SaveImage(args.result_name, result, args.SaveInt);
00221 
00222   exit (0);
00223         
00224 }
